values:
I had so much fun at Fantasy Festival and my designs sold really really well! What was so great was over 75% of the people who brought from me this weekend were repeat customers! I was thrilled to say the least!

Lisa was a HUGE help on Saturday for me. Man, I tell you she is just the greatest friend, I love the woman! 

I just downloaded what pictures I got to take, two of my very favorite teachers and their troupes, Odina & Khajulah doing a duet and a few others who were wearing my designs and danced. I will post pictures later tonight. The only bummer was a couple of times I could not get away from the booth, I was rushed with buyers and I missed a few key people I wanted to photograph. Hopefully next time. 

Update on Miri, she is doing great! running around, playing, napping eating me out of house and home! *grin* I can't wait for her removal of the plate, so that we are done with everything. her fur is growing back in and you can hardly see the scar on her leg and her feet are just great even with the missing toe. 

Yes, they double teamed me last night since I was gone pretty much the whole weekend. You know when kittens love you when one is laying on your head and the other on your chest and they are both purring away and sticking their butts in your face.

Thanks to everyone who asked about Dave's (my hubby) family. 
They are out of danger by living in North Liberty which is 10 miles from Iowa City and in fact are hosting 9 people who had to be evacuated from their homes in Iowa City.
I hope all of you have a very wonderful day!

I will be at both! I am going to be at Rakkasah all 3 days and Tribal Throwdown on Saturday morning. Khajulah's (Raks al Khalil) students are dancing at Rakkasah, I am the under-study, so if anyone breaks a leg, gets sick, has a flat tire then I will be dancing. Plus Esperanza is dancing Saturday morning at Tribal, so I will be that for that! Come down and watch some great belly dancing and shop, shop and shop! Here is all the info: Raks al Khalil: March 17th at 7:00 p.m.!!! (Our group is dancing!!!) Rakkasah West 2007 Middle Eastern Folk Festival and Fantasy Bazaar http://www.rakkasah.com Richmond Memorial Auditorium 27th Street and Nevin (Just off MacDonald Ave.) Richmond, CA Festival Dates & Fees Friday March 16, 7pm - 11pm $12 Saturday March 17, 11am - 11pm $15 Sunday March 18, 11am - 8pm $15 ZaZA (Esperanza) Dances at 10:59am! Tribal Throwdown http://www.tribalthrowdown.com/ Performances & Shopping at: Jewish Community Center 1414 Walnut Street Berkeley, CA Workshops at: Live Oak Center 1301 Shattuck Ave. Berkeley, CA Festival Dates: March 17th Admission: free workshops vary-check website. After throw party-check website for tickets & prices.

I will be there with a few wonderful friends, so come by and enjoy the show with us.

This year's event features Heather Stants and the Urban Tribal Dance Company. We'll start the weekend off with a kick-off party (Urban Tribal Lounge) at Club Caution (co-hosted by Crystal Silmi) which will include informal performances and spinning by DJ Vashti (that's me!). Heather will teach three amazing workshops over the course of the weekend. On Saturday night, we'll test out our new incredible venue for the evening show: the Henry Mello Center. In addition to Urban Tribal Dance Company, the lineup includes: Baktiari, Bellydance Odyssey Raks, Crystal, DaVid, Luna, namira, Nanna, Modern Gypsy, Rashid, Sabiba, Sandra The Hala Dance Company, Tribal Moon and Yasmine. This year's show, inspired by Heather's work, will have an interpretive thread. More info at 
http://www.bellydanceodyssey.com.

Thank you so much for our wonderful anniversary present!
I have it in the buffet and it looks so pretty!
I love my smiley face containers and they are up in the smiley room. 

You are such a doll!
oxoxoxoxox

Sarah
I hope it is wonderful!!! *huge hugs*

I got new hair, so I need new make up and new clothes. For once I need to be somewhat stylish. ;)

Suggestions on what you think would look good on me. 
Make up styles or colors you think I should use. 

Remember my hair is basically dark brown now, with just a hint of red and gold. 
I am plus size of course. 2x or 3x depending on the cut and style.
I have linebacker shoulders.
I have no ass.
I like dresses and tops with long sleeves or at least 3/4 sleeves. 
My complexion with the darker hair color has evened out actually, so I am fair with just a hint of peach. (mostly the freckles give me color) 
I am still putting on my make up the way I did 20 + years ago. 
My eyes are not a true blue, they have green and gold in them. 
I carry all my weight in my stomach, chest and back. (Think potato with legs)

My kitchen is really, really blue.
We just finished the 2nd coat. 

pics later.

We got a call into Noah the server guy to see what is up. 

Dave's sites are fine, mine is the only one down out of our 3.

I will be selling at two events this weekend, so please stop by and say hello and do some x-mas shopping. :) 1st 2nd-I am not on the flyer, they had a late cancellation and I was able to get in! woohoo!

Event: Belle Bizarre Bazaar Where: Center for Sex & Culture 398 11th Street (Near Harrison) San Francisco Phone: 415-861-1157 Shopping: 10am -9pm Party starts at 5pm Live show starts at 7pm Free Admission to shopping! More information here: http://www.sexworkerfest.com/belle_bizarre/

I got rid of a few journals that were inactive or people I don't really know
or people that were to negative, immature, selfish or otherwise totally incompatible with me. 

I will do more.

I am tired of having to watch what I say, how I say it or whom I say it to. This is my damn LJ!!!

If you haven't figured it out by now.
I don't do immaturity.
I don't do excuses. 
I don't do selfishness. 
I don't do negativity.
I don't do whining.

I hope some lucky trekkie gives it a good home.

From:XXXXXXX@XXXXXXXX.XXX
Subject: 	Dreaded
Date: 	April 29, 2005 9:17:28 AM PDT
To: 	  sarah@wickedsmileys.com
Wow.
 You are nuts.
 I am a hairdresser that was sent your site about
Jen doing your all ready awfull hair.
 Your a jerk.
-----------------------------------------------------
I will add it to my dread webpage and any other correspondence I receive. 

http://www.wickedsmileys.com/DreadOrdeal/
-------------------------------------------------
****Update***** 
I traced the email addy and she has her own website and is a hair police affiliate.
I took a look at her website, she has a good number of pictures up in her gallery and what caught my eye is that none of her clients have rubber bands in their dreads. Not a single rubber band AND I also noticed that their hair isn't wrapped  all around the dreads like mine was. All the pictures she has up of her dread work, look just like the pics that are on the hairpolice website. No wrapping, no rubber bands, etc. 

So very interesting, don't you think?

I am so excited!!! 
We are going to go and see it Saturday. I don't know if I am wearing a bathrobe or not, but I am going to see it!

Yes, I know I am a big Sci Fi geek and most of you have no idea what I am talking about, but GAWD! I love those books! I read the first in the series in 1979 when it was first published. Shit! I am old! I of course watched the BBC's TV show version when it was on and in reruns.  


I have seen the all the previews and Marvin & Zaphod are rocking my world! 
~squeel~ 
I can't wait!!!!

http://www.wickedsmileys.com/DreadOrdeal/

I spent all day working on this and I wanted the truth out there.
 Please let me know what you think.
"Character is what you know you are, not what others think you have." -Marva Collins, inner-city educator

"Destiny is something men select; woman achieve it only by default or stupendous suffering." -Harriet Rosenstein, women's libber "Nothing can tell us so much about the general lawlessness of humanity as a perfect acquaintance with our own immoderate behavior." -Madeleine de Souvre~, seventeenth-century French maximist "Irony is the hygiene of the mind." -Elizabeth Bibesco, British princess and penswoman and lastly... "Great events make me quiet and calm; it is only trifles that irritate my nerves." -Victoria, Queen of England
Come support our local artists or just stop by and say hello and chit chat with me. :)

Yes, folks it is that time of year again for naughty fun, some fetish delights, dungeons and drag queens! Come see the fashion show! I am working with Leather Masters again! You will see their new designs and mine! PLUS Esperanza will be performing! woohoo! her performances are always FAN-FUCKING-TASTIC!

I know you are getting hit and hit hard with the rains, please, please check in so I dont worry!

If you need anything email, call or post!
I used my favorite pic of you and my favorite font. :) :)
DOESNT IT ROCK?!!!! I love it!!!!

I enjoyed myself so much. :) Hanging out and chatting and bringing you hair goodies was wonderful. Dinner at the sausage factory was great! 

Thank you so much for a lovely evening and I hope that you and Stray come to Star Trek when you have some free time. :) 

I will say it again, the purple and black switchblades I made you are now my absolute favorite creation! I cant wait to get pics of you in those! 

*hugs*

My hubby:
" I am sorry you needed me so long and you had to wait so long to find me."

Me: 
"Honey, you were worth the wait."

That ladies and gentlemen is my husband in a nutshell. 
No frills, no glitter and no glamor. 
Nothing but pure love.

wow!!!! I just cant believe it! My son is 20! 

He has already opened some of his presents up and had breakfast. :) 

He is turning out to be such a great person! He just amazes me.

Zipping one of your dreads up in your purse. 

Spending 5 minutes getting it unzipped from your purse.

And I believe that people get them mixed up far to often. 

Don't let what you "think" or what "you think you see" dictate what is actual. 

Take the good with the bad. 

Make the effort. Sometimes you will give far more then you receive, but it will balance out somewhere down the road.

There are different kinds of friendship. Try to remember that. 

Friendships change over time, sometimes for the better, sometimes not. 

Change is constant. 

Time is always passing and you cant get it back.

Airplane tickets bought! Now just get the room changed over and we are set!

~See Sarah doing the smiley dance~
*shakin that ass*
*shakin that ass*

Woohoo!!! I am so excited! 

So far we got Dragoness, StemOfThorns and her sweetie, Me & my Dave. 

If any of you want to come, please email me or Dragoness so we help you get your stuff booked. WE are staying at a hotel in the french quarter!! Woohoo!!! WE want as many of the Wickedsmileys Dolls & friends to go as possible. WE are going to be there the 8th-12th, the full trip is scheduled for the 8th-15th.

I am making everyone something to wear just for Mardi gras!

Here they are! The hubby took them, so the angle is a bit off and I look a hell of allot shorter then I am, but at least you get to see the outfit. :) This was not our best photoshoot folks. The corset is made with Asian character print silk and trimmed with black PVC, then she added black asian closures all down the front. The Kimono is Black PVC trimmed with the Asian character print silk.

I am making Garlic shrimp Alfredo pasta to take to the Ken & Sarah's yearly party. Fun, fun, fun. and I had to make some baby quiches and mushroom pockets. Why I am doing this is the heat I will never know. But then I get cooking and well I cake stop. I had a good time at Stilettos last night, lots of wonderful compliments on my hair, wonderful people I look forward to seeing every week, BUT...and I do mean BUT the music was not good, in fact is was bouncing all over the place, just awful. I was very disappointed and actually irritated. When I tip a DJ and ask for them to play 80's I expect 80's and at least something decent. Whatever was going on last night was not good, not good at all. And I was not the only one that noticed. What makes Stilettos is the place, the people AND THE MUSIC. It is 80's & electroclash, not goth, not industrial, not hip hop, not ghetto. If I want industrial/goth I can go wed. nights or run up to SF for DeathGuild. If I want hip hop or ghetto I can to any yuppie local club. That is why I come, I come for the people AND THE MUSIC. I will be posting pics tomorrow of my wonderful new dress and corset I got from Darkwear. yay! dress up for me! My brother in law may be here next week for a visit. Got to run. More later.

I got my Kimono and over bust corset today in the mail and they are just GORGEOUS! I am so thrilled! 

I will get all dolled up this weekend and post some pics for you. 

Thank you doll I just love it! I tried to call and missed you, so hopefully I will catch you later tonight. 

*hugs & smooches~

Thank you Krissi so much for calling me doll! It was so much fun!!

Folks she sounds just like you imagine her sounding with the sexy Auzzie accent. *wink* *wink* 

She is just divine!!! 

We will have to do this again and soon! 

Huggies!

We got a major slow down since around 10pm last night. 

Our server guy has been notified. I am hoping for some news soon.

I really think that people that put "buy my crap"  or " getting rid of my crap" or "my crap for sale" is in really poor taste. 

I mean come on folks have some class will ya! 

If I had wanted to buy "crap" I can hit the local flea market and garage sales or for that matter dig in my own garage. 

*rolls eyes*
